tool.name: Colocolize
tool.description: Make mask of colocolized regions from two images.
tool.command: colocolize.py $input_dict $input_image_path $output_path_coloc_masks $channel1_name $channel2_name $outfile #if str($c1min) !='': -min1 $c1min #end if #if str($c1max) !='': -max1 $c1max #end if #if str($c2min) !='': -min2 $c2min #end if #if str($c2max) !='': -max2 $c2max #end if

param.name: input_image_path
param.label: Enter path to images that will be used in colocalization. Example: AlignedImages

param.name: output_path_coloc_masks
param.label: Enter path to write colocolization masks. Example: ColocMasks

param.name: channel1_name
param.label: Enter unique channel identifier for channel1. This should match the characters in filename.

param.name: channel2_name
param.label: Enter unique channel identifier for channel2. This should match the characters in filename.

param.name: c1min
param.label: Minimum intentisy to use for channel 1. Ex. 10

param.name: c1max
param.label: Maximum intentisy to use for channel 1. Ex. 255

param.name: c2min
param.label: Minimum intentisy to use for channel 2. Ex. 10

param.name: c2max
param.label: Maximum intentisy to use for channel 2. Ex. 255

tool.help: Use min and max intensities for each channel to threshold images and return mask of co-occuring pixels.
